metadata.title: CVE-2018-5358 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
ImageMagick 7.0.7-22 Q16 has memory leaks in the EncodeImageAttributesfunction in coders/json.c, as demonstrated by the ReadPSDLayersInternalfunction in coders/psd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5358` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
